required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MI With Text Messaging to Reduce Sexual Risk and Hazardous Drinking Among MSM
clinical_study.official_title: Alcohol and Implicit Process in Sexual Risk Behavior in MSM Supplement

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a small pilot study to provide effect size estimates for a brief intervention designed to reduce hazardous drinking and sexual risk behavior among men who have sex with men. The intervention consists of an "in-person" brief motivational intervention followed by a series of text messages related to alcohol and sexual risk reduction. The primary outcome is heavy drinking episodes and frequency of unprotected anal intercourse at 3 months.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a pilot study designed to provide initial effect size estimates for an intervention addressing hazardous drinking and sexual risk behavior among men who have sex with men. In this study, 24 participants initially recruited through advertisements in the community will be randomly assigned to either Assessment Only or Intervention Condition. Those in the Assessment Only condition will complete baseline, 6-week, 3-month and 6-month assessments. Those in the intervention condition will receive a 50-min brief intervention in person followed by 6 weeks of tailored app-based messaging to support the intervention content, then another 6-weeks of goal setting text-based messages. Data will be analyzed to determine effect sizes of the intervention on key alcohol use and sex risk outcomes. The primary outcome will be 3-month outcomes, controlling for corresponding baseline outcomes.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are randomly assigned to one of two groups
study_design_info.masking_description: The outcomes assessor is not provided with randomization information for the subjects

primary_outcome.measure: Number of heavy drinking episodes NIAAA criteria (5 or more drinks on a single occasion)
primary_outcome.description: Number of heavy drinking episodes in the past 30 days [main time point at 3 month follow-up]. This question is an open ended question that asks the participant to report the number of times in the past 30 days that he has consumed 5 or more drinks on a single occasion [no scale]

primary_outcome.measure: Number of unprotected anal intercourse episodes (UAI) from the Sexual Behaviors Survey (Gordon et al., 2007) is used to measure sexual risk [main time point at 3 month follow-up]
primary_outcome.description: Frequency of UAI in past 90 days. This is an open ended question where the Participant report the frequency of unprotected anal intercourse episodes over a period of 90 days [no scale]

primary_outcome.measure: Modified Daily Drinking Questionnaire- Typical number of standard drinks per week over the past month
primary_outcome.description: Average quantity of alcohol use per week in the past 30 days. Participants complete a seven day calendar which reflects the typical number of standard drinks that they have consumed for each day of the week over the past 30 days. The number of drinks can range from 0 to an unlimited high number. A higher number of drinks listed in the week is reflective of a worse outcome

secondary_outcome.description: Number of alcohol-related consequences in the past month. This is the 48-item Yes/No version of the YAACQ. The range for the score is 0-48.

other_outcome.measure: Number of UAI past 6 weeks from the Sexual Behaviors Survey item described above.
other_outcome.description: Will examine the number of UAI in the 6 weeks following the baseline as an additional outcome

arm_group.description: This intervention arm is a combined in-person text messaging intervention
The is the assessment only comparison condition

intervention.description: brief in-person intervention followed by text messaging

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 1 heavy drinking episode or consumption of more than 14 drinks per week over the past month
- At least 1 unprotected anal sex episode in past 3 months
- Score of 3 or greater on the Kinsey Scale (Kinsey et al., 1948) indicating at least "equally heterosexual and homosexual". Scale ranges from 0 (exclusively heterosexual) to 6 (exclusively homosexual)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Alcohol treatment currently or in past 3 years
- Bipolar disorder or schizophrenia treatment
- Exclusive monogamous relationship

facility.name: Boston University Department of Psychological and Brain Science

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be shared following release within one year of the trial end to investigators who make specific requests in writing regarding analysis plans. Plans will be reviewed with co-investigators to ensure that there is no overlap with planned analyses. Specific de-identified data set will be provided to other researchers after this review
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available one year after the trial end. They will be available for investigators to request up to 5 years following their release
